title: Feature: World Series MVP selection grid
custom_preconds: Given: User has navigated to the "2020 World Series MVP Vote" screen
custom_steps: When the user views the screen
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a "2020 World Series MVP Vote" banner
And the sponsor's images on the banner
And under the banner, text that explains the voting system
And a left-hand column of American League Team players, under a colored header
And a right-hand column of the National League Team players, under a colored header
And the players are listed in alphabetical order
And a text panel of the contest rules
And a "Back to top" link

title: Feature: Position Player grid detail
custom_preconds: Given: User has navigated to the "2019 World Series MVP Vote" screen
custom_steps: When the user views any position player element on the grid
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the:
- Player's photo image
- Player's name
- Player's position (abbreviated, e.g. 3B)
- <Value> Avg. (Batting)
- <Value> HR (Home Runs)
- <Value> RBI (Runs Batted In)
- <Value> OPS (On-base plus Slugging)

title: Feature: Pitcher grid detail
custom_preconds: Given: User has navigated to the "2019 World Series MVP Vote" screen
custom_steps: When the user views any pitcher element on the grid
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the:
- Player's photo image
- Player's name
- Player's position (P abbreviated for Pitcher)
- <Value> Record (e.g. 9-5)
- <Value> ERA (Earned Run Average)
- <Value> K (Strikeouts)
- <Value> WHIP (Walks plus hits per inning pitched)

title: Feature: "Your MVP Selection" screen
custom_preconds:
Given: User has selected an MVP 
   And has been redirected to the "Your MVP Selection" screen
custom_steps: When the user views the "Your MVP Selection" screen
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a "2019 World Series MVP Vote" banner
And the sponsor's images on the banner
And the label, "Your MVP Selection"
And an "Edit Selection" link
And the
- Player's team logo
- Player's photo image
- Player's name
And a required form to complete the user's vote

title: Feature: MVP Selection form
custom_preconds:
Given: User has selected an MVP 
   And has been redirected to the "Your MVP Selection" screen
   And has scrolled to the label,
   "Fill out the form below to complete your vote"
custom_steps:
When the user enters text on the form:
- Email address
- Birth Date (using the Month/Date/Year drop down menus)
- Zip/Postal Code
- Country (using the drop down menu)
- Select your favorite team (using the drop down menu)
   And selects the " I would like to receive the MLB.com..."
   checkbox
   And ticks the "I am not a robot" checkbox
   And taps the "Submit your Vote" button
custom_expected:
Then the "Thank you for voting! You voted for" screen opens
   And the player selection displayed is correct

title: Feature:  User edits selection
custom_preconds: Given: User has selected an MVP And has been redirected to the "Your MVP Selection" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Edit Selection" link
custom_expected:
Then the user is returned to the  "2019 World Series MVP Vote" screen
   And the user's previous choice has not been retained 
   And the user can vote for the same or different player

title: Feature:  User votes again
custom_preconds:
Given:  User has successfully completed his/her MVP vote
   And is on the "Thank you for voting! You voted for" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Vote Again" button
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the "2019 World Series MVP Vote" screen
   And the user can vote for the same player as many times
   as he/she wishes

title:
Feature:  User attempts to vote again without 
selecting the Captcha checkbox
custom_preconds:
Given:  User has successfully completed his/her MVP vote
   And is on the "Thank you for voting! You voted for" page
   And does not select the I'm not a robot" checkbox
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Vote Again" button
custom_expected:
Then an error message displays
   And shows this text:  "A value is required for this field"

title: Feature: "Back to top" link
custom_preconds:
Given: User has navigated to the "2019 World Series MVP Vote" screen
   And scrolls to the bottom of the page
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Back to top" link
custom_expected:
Then the page auto-scrolls to the top
And the "2019 World Series MVP Vote" banner is visible

title: Feature: Cannot vote if you are under 13 yearsold
custom_preconds:
Given user has successfully completed MVP vote
And is filling out form with user information
And enters a DOB that makes user less than 13 yrs old
custom_steps:
When user clicks submit your vote
And completes captcha
custom_expected: Then error message shows "You are ineligible to complete this form"
